TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SetStateActivity extends System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Provides the transition to a in a state machine workflow. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]
The SetStateActivity can be used only in state machine workflows.
The SetStateActivity provides transitions only to leaf <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.StateActivity> activities (a <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.StateActivity> that does not contain other <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.StateActivity> activities).
The SetStateActivity only provides transitions between two <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.StateActivity> classes and does not support <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.StateActivity> to parent <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.StateActivity> transitions or any other combination.
The SetStateActivity has to be a leaf node within the activity tree of an event handler.
There can be more than one SetStateActivity but all the activities must be leaf nodes.
SetStateActivity is always the last activity in the run path of a <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.EventDrivenActivity> activity.
[!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] the [Simple State Machine](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/1974edbd-253d-4e01-9095-38ff9c3e749e) sample.

This code example is part of the SimpleStateMachineWorkflow SDK Sample from the StateMachineWorkflow.cs file. For more information, see [Simple State Machine](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/1974edbd-253d-4e01-9095-38ff9c3e749e).

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example shows how to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.SetStateActivity> class and use it implement a simple state machine to transition between 3 states, and set the value of the TargetStateName property. This code example is part of the SimpleStateMachineWorkflow SDK Sample from the StateMachineWorkflow.cs file. For more information, see [Simple State Machine](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/1974edbd-253d-4e01-9095-38ff9c3e749e).
[!code-cs[WF_Samples#183](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/wf_snippets/snippets19.cs#183)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#183](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/wf_snippets/snippets19.vb#183)]
